Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh, ah, excuse me, can you tell me where I am?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: How many times have I told you to knock?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Shoo with your pointy heads. Why are you always under boot?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Have you checked the axis? Is rotation balanced?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Make preparations! We are going to have company.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: I know, I know, but I obviously wouldn't have called you all here unless it was serious.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Yes! There was black sand covering the globe.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: What, what...what do you mean black sand?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Hold on, hold on, I thought you said you saw Pitch.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Not exactly? Can you believe this guy?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Look, he is up to something very bad. I feel it, in my belly.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Hang on, hang on, you mean to say, you summoned me here THREE DAYS BEFORE EASTER - because of your belly? Mate, if I did this to you three days before Christmas--

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Argentina. Priority alert! A batch of bicuspids in Buenos Aires.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Please. Bunny. Easter is not Christmas.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Look, mate, I'm dealing with perishables. Right. You've got all year to prepare.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Pittsburg, boy eight, two molars. Saltwater taffy.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Why are rabbits always so nervous.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: And why are you always such a blowhard!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Tooth! Can't you see we're trying to argue.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Sorry, not all of us get to work one night a year. Am I right, Sandy?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: San Diego, sector two! Five incisors, a bicuspid and a really loose molar on stand-by.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Come on, mate, Pitch went out with the dark ages. We made sure of that - remember?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Aah! Man in Moon! Sandy, why didn't you say something?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: It's been a long time old friend! What is big news?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Ah, guys, you know what this means?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Must be big deal! Manny thinks we need help!

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Since when do we need help?!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: I wonder who it's gonna be?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Please not the groundhog, please not the groundhog.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Ah, I take it back! The Groundhog's fine!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Well, ah, as long he helps to ah...to protect the children, right?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Jack Frost!? He doesn't care about children! All he does is freeze water pipes and mess with my egg hunts. Right? He's an irresponsible, selfish...

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Jack Frost is many things, but he is not a Guardian.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Huh, that looks interesting. Good book?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Hey guys, wait up! Are you guys coming to the egg hunt Sunday?

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: I hope we can find the eggs with all this snow!

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Whoa, it says here that they found Big Foot hair samples and DNA, in Michigan. That's like, super close!

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: You saw the video too Claude, he's out there!

Speaker: caleb
Dialogue: That's what you said about aliens.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Wow, the Easter Bunny is real!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh he's real alright. Real annoying, real grumpy, and really full of himself.

Speaker: claude
Dialogue: Come on, you guys believe anything.

Speaker: jamie's mom
Dialogue: Jamie, hat? We don't want Jack Frost nipping at your nose.

Speaker: jamie's mom
Dialogue: No one, honey. It's just an expression.

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: Jamie! Turn, turn! That's the street! What are you doing? Stop! There's traffic!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Whoa, don't worry kid, I gotcha.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hold on. It's gonna be alright.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Keep up with me kid! Take a left.

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: Wow, that looks serious! Jamie! Jamie, are you alright? Is he okay?

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Whoaaa! Did you guys see that? It was amazing! I slid - I did a jump and I slid under a car-ERF!!

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: Dude, that means cash! Tooth Fairy cash! I love the Tooth Fairy!

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: That's totally awesome. You lucky bug! Lucky!

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: I gotta put this under my pillow!

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: I wish I lost my tooth.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Ah, wait a minute! Come on, hold on, hold on! What about all that fun we just had? That wasn't the Tooth Fairy, that was me!

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: I lost two teeth in one day once - remember that?! What are you gonna spend your money on? What are you gonna buy? How much do you think she's going to leave?

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: Let's go...I'm cooold! My ears are freezing. I can't feel my toes. Ah, it's hot cocoa time.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What's a guy gotta do to get a little attention around here!

Speaker: cupcake
Dialogue: "Oh, I'm cold, I'm cold, I'm co- old."

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: -- and then BAM! The sofa hit me, and, and see?  Ah hoo hay ow!

Speaker: jamie's mom
Dialogue: Alright you, tooth under your pillow?

Speaker: jamie's mom
Dialogue: Now don't stay up trying to see her, Jamie, or she won't come.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: But I can do it this time! You wanna help me, Soph? We can hide and see the Tooth Fairy!

Speaker: jamie's mom
Dialogue: Uh uh, straight to bed now, mister.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: If there's something I'm doing wrong, can you, can you just tell me what it is?  You put me here, the least you can do is tell me, tell me why.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Ohhhh, I thought I heard the clippity-clop of a unicorn. What an adorable dream!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: And look. At. Her. Precious child. So sweet, so full of hope and wonder. Why, there's only one thing missing...a touch of fear.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Feel your fear. Come on. Come on, that's right.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Yesss. What a pretty little Nightmare.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Now, I want you to go tell the others the wait is over.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Don't look at me like that, old friend. You must have known this day would come. My Nightmares are finally ready. Are your Guardians?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Been a long time. Blizzard of 68, I believe? Easter Sunday, wasn't it?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Bunny? You're not still mad about that...are yah?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Me?  Not on your nelly. See you back at the pole.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Walla Walla, Washington. We've got a trampoline mishap at 1340 Ginger Lane.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Hey, there he is! Jack Frost!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Wow, you gotta be kidding me.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hey, hey. Whoa, put me down.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: I hope the yetis treated you well?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. I love being shoved in a sack and tossed through a magic portal.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Oh, good! That was my idea! You know Bunny, obviously.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Hello, Jack. I've heard a lot about you. And your teeth.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Oh, they really do sparkle like freshly fallen snow.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Girls, pull yourselves together... Let's not disgrace the uniform.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: And Sandman.  Sandy! Sandy! Wake up!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hey! Ho! Anyone wanna tell me why I'm here?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: That's not really helping. But thanks, little man.  I musta done something really bad to get you four together.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Am I on the naughty list?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: On naughty list? You hold record! But no matter. We overlook. Now we are wiping clean the slate.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: How come? I tell you how come! Because now...you are Guardian!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What are you doing! Get, get that offa me!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: What makes you think I want to be a Guardian?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Look, this is all very flattering, but ah...you don't want me. You're all hard work and deadlines, and I'm snowballs and fun times. I'm not a Guardian.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Yeah, that's exactly what I said!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Jack...I don't think you understand what it is we do.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Each of those lights is a child.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: A child who believes. And good or bad, naughty or nice, we protect them.  Tooth...fingers out of mouth.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Okay, no more wishy-washy! Pitch is out there doing who knows what!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Yes! When Pitch threatens us, he threatens them as well.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: All the more reason to pick someone more qualified!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Pick? You think we pick? No, you were chosen like we were all chosen. By Man in Moon.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Last night, Jack. He chose you.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The Man in the Moon, he talks to you?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: You see, you can not say no. It is destiny.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: But why, why wouldn't he tell me that himself?  After 300 years this is his answer? To spend eternity like you guys cooped up in some, some hideout thinking of, of new ways to bribe kids? No no, that's not for me. No offense.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: You know what I think? I think we just dodged a bullet. I mean, what's this clown know about bringing joy to children anyway?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Uhh, you ever hear of a snow day? I know it's no hard-boiled egg, but kids like what I do.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: But none of 'em believe in you.  Do they? You see, you're invisible, mate. It's like you don't even exist.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: The, the what -- what'd you call me? I am not a kangaroo, mate.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh. And this whole time I thought you were. If you're not a kangaroo, what are you?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: I'm a bunny. The Easter Bunny. People believe in me.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's nothing personal, North. What you all do, it's just, it's not my thing.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Man in Moon says it is your thing. We will see!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Slow down, wouldja? I've been trying to bust in here for years, I want a good look.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh, don't worry, I never got past the yetis.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Whoa!  I always thought the elves made the toys.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: We just let them believe that.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Very nice! Keep up good work!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: I don't like it. Paint it red.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Now we get down to tacks of brass!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Who are you, Jack Frost? What is your center?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: If Man in Moon chose you to be a Guardian, you must have something very special inside.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Look closer. What do you see?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Yes! Big eyes. Very big. Because they are full! Of wonder! That is my center. It is what I was born with. Eyes that have always seen the wonder in everything!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Eyes that see lights in the trees, and magic in the air!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: This wonder is what I put into the world, and what I protect in children.  It is what makes me a Guardian. It is my center. What is yours?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: We have a problem, mate! Trouble at the Tooth Palace.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: North, North! I told you, I'm not going with you guys! There is no way I'm climbing into some rickety old...

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Hey! Moi deti, moi deti. Quiet, quiet.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Okay, one ride, but that's it.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: I think my tunnels might be faster, mate. And um, and safer.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa, where are the bloody seatbelts?!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: I hope you like the loopty loops!

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Ah, rack off you bloody show pony!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Hold on everyone, I know a shortcut.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Oh strewth, I knew we should have taken the tunnels.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hey little Baby Tooth, you okay?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: They, they took my fairies! And the teeth! All of them! Everything is gone! Everything.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Oh thank goodness! One of you is alright!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: The Big Four, all in one place. I'm a little star-struck.  Did you like my show on the globe, North? Got you all together, didn't I?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Pitch, you have got thirty seconds to return my fairies!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: You'll stick a quarter under my pillow?

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Maybe I want what you have. To be believed in.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Maybe I'm tired of hiding under beds.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Ah, go suck an egg, rabbit!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: A neutral party. Then I'm going to ignore you. But, you must be used to that by now.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Pitch! You shadow sneaking rat- bag! Come here!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Look familiar, Sandman? Took me a while to perfect this little trick. Turning dreams into Nightmares.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Don't be nervous, it only riles them up more. They smell fear you know.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: What fear? Of you!? No one's been afraid of you since the Dark Ages!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: They, they don't believe in me anymore.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Didn't they tell you, Jack? It's great being a Guardian -- but there's a catch. If enough kids stop believing, everything your friends protect - wonder, hopes and dreams - it all goes away. And little by little, so do they.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: No Christmas, or Easter, or little fairies that come in the night. There will be nothing. But fear and darkness and me! It's your turn not to be believed in!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: You should've seen them. They put up such a fight.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Why would Pitch take the teeth?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: It's not the teeth he wanted. It's the memories inside them.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: That's why we collect the teeth, Jack. They hold the most important memories of childhood.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: From when you were young. Before you became Jack Frost.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: But, I wasn't anyone before I was Jack Frost.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Of course you were. We were all someone before we were chosen.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Hey, I told you never to mention that!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: That night at the pond...I just, why I assumed...Are you saying, are you saying I had a life before that? With a home? And a family?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: All these years, and the answers were right here. If I find my memories, then I'll know why I'm here.  You have to show me.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: I...I can't, Jack. Pitch has them.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Then we have to get them back!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: No! No! No such thing as too late!  Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. Idea!! HAHH!!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: We get teeth! Children keep believing in you!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: We're talking seven continents! Millions of kids!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Give me break! You know how many toys I deliver in one night?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: And eggs I hide in one day?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: And Jack, if you help us, we will get you your memories.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Here we go, here we go...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Hop to it rabbit, I'm five teeth ahead!

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Yeah right, look, I'd tell you to stay outta my way, but really what's the point -- because you won't be able to keep up anyway.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Oh, you don't wanna race a rabbit, mate.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: A race? Is it a race??

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Four bicuspids over there! An incisor two blocks east! Is that a molar? They're EVERYWHERE!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Fine...sorry, it's been a really long time since I've been out in the field.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: How long is a long time?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Ah, four hundred forty years...give or take.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Looks like you're a bit of a brumby, hey mate.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Take it easy there, champ! He's one of us! Part of the European division.  Ca va?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Wow! You guys collect teeth and leave gifts as fast as my fairies.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: The lights...why aren't they going out?

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Oh pipe down, or I'll stuff a pillow with you!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Fine, have your last hurrah. For tomorrow, all you pathetic scrambling will be for nothing.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: This was always the part I liked most - seeing the kids.  Why did I ever stop doing this?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's a little different up close, huh?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Thanks for being here, Jack. I wish I had known about your memory, I could've helped you.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Yeah, well, look let's just get you taken care of. Then it's Pitch's turn, huh?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Haha! That's what I want to hear.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You think I need help to beat a bunny? Check it out, Peter Cottontail.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: You call that a bag of choppers?  Now that's a bag of choppers.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Gentlemen! Gentlemen! This is about Tooth. It's not a competition! But if it was --  I win. YEEEEEHAAAHH!

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Shhh! You guys, he's still awake.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: No, stop that's the Easter Bunny. What are you doing, Abbey? Down!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: But that's a um, that's a greyhound. Do you know what greyhounds do to rabbits?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: I think it's a pretty safe bet he's never met a rabbit like me -

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Hey, this is not proper Tooth Fairy behavior!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Oh, I really wish I had a camera right now.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Sandy! Sandy, did you see that?!? Look at this thing!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: You know, for a "neutral party" you spend an awful lot of time with those weirdos.  This isn't your fight, Jack.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You made it my fight when you stole those teeth.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Teeth? Why do you care about the teeth?

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Now this is who I'm looking for--

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Remind me not to get on your bad side.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Okay, easy! You can't blame me for trying, Sandy. You don't know what it's like to be weak and hated. It was stupid of me to mess with your dreams. So I'll tell you what-

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You take the ones on the left, I'll take the ones on the right?

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Hahahahaha!...Don't fight the fear, little man.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: I'd say sweet dreams, but there aren't any left.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Jack, how did you do that?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I, I didn't know I could.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Finally! Someone who knows how to have a little FUN!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I just, I wish I could've done something.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Done something? Jack, you stood up to Pitch. You saved us.

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Would be proud of what you did.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: But how can I know who I am, until I find out who I was?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: You will. I feel it, in my belly.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Look how fast they're going out.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's fear. He's tipped the balance.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Easter is tomorrow and I need your help. I say we pull out all the stops and we get those little lights flickering again!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Bunny is right.  As much as it pains me to say old friend, this time Easter is more important than Christmas!

Speaker: north
Dialogue: We must hurry to the Warren. Everyone, to the sleigh!

Speaker: bunny
Dialogue: Ohh no, mate. My warren my rules. Buckle up.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Don't look at me, I'm invisible, remember?

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Awww! You know what, I got something for you. Here it is.  Look at all the pretty teeth with little blood and gum on them.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Blood and gums? When was the last time you guys actually hung out with kids?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: We are very busy bringing joy to children! We don't have time...  ...for children.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: If one little kid can ruin Easter, then...we're in worse shape than I thought.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: You wanna paint some eggs? Yeah?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: Rimsky Korsakov! That's a lot of eggs.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Uh, how much time do we have?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: There will be springtime! On every continent! And I'm bringing hope with me!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Look, I'm sorry about that whole, you know, the "kangaroo" thing.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Ah, poor little ankle-biter. Look at her, all tuckered out.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: I think it's time to get her home.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: How about I take her home?

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Which is why we need you here, with us.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Trust me, I'll be quick as a bunny.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: That voice, I know that voice...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I have to find out what that is.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm gonna get you out of here, just as soon as I --

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Maybe not. But you are afraid of something.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: I know so. It's the one thing I always know.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Well fear not, for the answer to that...

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Do you want them, Jack? Your memories?

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Why did you end up like this? Unseen. Unable to reach out to anyone.  You want the answers so badly. You want to grab them, and fly off with them. But you're afraid of what the Guardians will think.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: You're afraid of disappointing them.  Well let me ease your mind about one thing. They'll never accept you. Not really.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: After all, you're not one of them.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You don't know what I am!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Of course I do. You're Jack Frost. You make a mess wherever you go. Why, you're doing it right now.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: More to the point Jack, what did you do?

Speaker: british kids
Dialogue: There are no eggs. There's none anywhere. I give up. Come on, let's go. I don't understand.

Speaker: british girl
Dialogue: Maybe he just hid them really well this year.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: Yes there is! There is! I mean these aren't my best lookin' googies, but they'll do in a pinch!

Speaker: british girl
Dialogue: There's no such thing as the Easter Bunny.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: No! Wrong! Not, not true! I'm right in front of ya, mate!

Speaker: british kids
Dialogue: There's no such thing. I know.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: They don't see me.  They don't see me.

Speaker: tooth
Dialogue: Where's Baby Tooth?  Oh Jack, what have you done?

Speaker: north
Dialogue: That is why you weren't here?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No, listen, listen...I'm sorry. I didn't mean for this to happen.

Speaker: bunnymund
Dialogue: We should never have trusted you!  And now it's gone.

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Guys, I told you - I saw him! He's way bigger than I thought, and he's got these cool boomerang-things-

Speaker: caleb
Dialogue: It was a dream. You should be happy you still get dreams like that and not...

Speaker: pippa
Dialogue: Forget it, Jamie. There's just no Easter this year.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: No? I don't know what it's like to be cast out?

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Yes! Look at what we can do!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: And Jack Frost too. They'll believe in both of us.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: No, they'll fear both of us. And that's not what I want.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Very well. You want to be left alone? Done. But first...

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: No. You said you wanted to be alone.  So be alone!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Sorry, all I can do is keep you cold.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Pitch was right - I make a mess of everything.

Speaker: jack's mother
Dialogue: Come on Jack, you can't have fun all the time.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's okay. It's okay. Don't look down, just look at me.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I know, I know...but you're gonna be alright. You're not gonna fall in. We're gonna have a little fun instead.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Well, alright. Well, not, not this time. I promise. I promise, you're gonna be...you're gonna be fine.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You have to believe in me.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Did you -- did you see that?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It -- it was me! I had a family! I had a sister!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We have to get out of here.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Come on Baby Tooth! I owe you one.

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: You're all free to go! We won't be needing any Christmas toys this year, thank you! Nor ever again!

Speaker: pitch
Dialogue: Only six left! Six precious children who still believe in the Guardians with all their h--  TWO!

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: Okay look, you and I are obviously at what they call a crossroads, so here's what's gonna happen -

Speaker: jamie
Dialogue: I've believed in you for a long time, okay? Like my whole life in fact. So you kinda owe me now.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: That's right! But-but that's me! Jack Frost! That's my name! You said my name!

Dialogue: Wait, can you hear me?  He sees me. He sees me!
